introduction.p: When working with rational exponents, we will need to perform operations on fractions.
Rational exponents may also be written in decimal form.

solution.p: The numerator of the fraction is 016, or 16. The last digit, 6, is in the thousandths place, so the denominator of the fraction is 1000. Thus, 0.016=\dfrac{16}{1000}. We can reduce this fraction by dividing top and bottom by 8: ~ \dfrac{16}{1000} = \dfrac{\cancel{8} \cdot 2}{\cancel{8} \cdot 125} = \dfrac{2}{125}
This is a nonterminating decimal, which we indicate by a repeater bar: \dfrac{5}{11}= 0.45454545 ... = 0.\overline{45}

statement.p: Solve ~0.6x^4 = 578. Round your answer to hundredths.

solution.p: First, we isolate the power. x^{2/3}-4 \amp = 60 \amp\amp \blert{\text{Add 4 to both sides.}} x^{2/3} \amp = 64 We raise both sides to the reciprocal of the power. \left(x^{2/3}\right)^{3/2} \amp = 64^{3/2} \amp\amp \blert{64^{3/2}=\left(64^{1/2}\right)^3=8^3} x \amp = 512 Or we can evaluate ~64^{3/2}~ by entering ~~64 1.5 ENTER
